answerText: E3 ubiquitin ligases [prompt on ligase][10] An important ubiquitin ligase is a promoting complex named for this phase of mitosis. This phase occurs after metaphase, and during it, the sister chromatids get pulled apart.
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | J Sergeant Reynolds-Ohio State-St. Johns | 15 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name these enzymes which are often denoted E3 to contrast with similar activating and conjugating enzymes. They act on proteins' lysine residues.
